arts.athr: Ed Aarons at the Emirates Stadium
arts.sum: Job done for Mikel Arteta. After the week heâ€™s had, the last thing the Arsenal manager would have wanted was another frantic finale to a home fixture. For much of this contest, after Declan Rice had fired the hosts in front after only 72 seconds, it seemed Arsenal may have to go the distance as they huffed and puffed but couldnâ€™t find a second goal to see off a spirited Dinamo Zagreb side managed by their defensive master Fabio Cannavaro. A collective sigh of relief greeted the second goal from Kai Havertz â€“ his 14th of the season â€“ when it eventually came 20 minutes before the end as Martin Ã˜degaard added a third late on to virtually ensure Arsenal will finish in the top eight and avoid the need for a playoff next month. With a warm-weather training camp in Dubai lined up instead, after their early exit from the FA Cup, it could do Artetaâ€™s weary squad the world of good in the long run. Continue reading...
